title: 115_s1264
content: The Act titled "Community Bank Sensible Regulation Act of 2017" grants exemptive authority to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act grants the Corporation the authority to exempt depository institutions with less than $10 billion in total assets from certain provisions and rules. The Corporation may impose conditions on any exemptions granted and must consider specific factors before granting an exemption. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act allows the Corporation to exempt depository institutions with less than $10 billion in total assets from certain provisions and rules. The exemption is subject to conditions and requires consideration of factors such as burden, necessity for safety, soundness, and public interest. The asset threshold is annually adjusted based on the percentage change in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions. The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency has exemptive authority as per SEC. 3. The Comptroller of the Currency may exempt national banks with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules under the Revised Statutes. The Comptroller of the Currency may grant exemptions to national banks with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules under various titles or Acts. Conditions may be imposed on these exemptions, and factors considered include burden on the bank, necessity for safety and soundness, and alignment with the public interest. The asset threshold for exemptions for national banks may be increased annually based on the change in total assets of insured depository institutions. Additionally, savings associations are granted exemptive authority under certain conditions. The Comptroller may exempt savings associations with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules under the Act, with conditions and factors to consider. The Comptroller may exempt savings associations with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules under the Act based on factors like burden, safety, soundness, and public interest. The asset threshold will be annually adjusted based on the change in total aggregate assets. The Comptroller may exempt savings associations with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules under the Act. The asset threshold will be annually adjusted based on the percentage change in the total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions for each 12-month period ending in December of each year, rounded to the nearest $10,000,000. SEC. 4. EXEMPTIVE AUTHORITY FOR THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM. Exemptive Authority With Respect to State Member Banks: The Federal Reserve Act is amended to grant the Board the authority to exempt State member banks with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules of the Act. The Board has the authority to grant exemptions to State member banks with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules of the Federal Reserve Act. Conditions may be imposed on the exemptions, and factors considered include burden/cost, safety/soundness, and public interest. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 is amended to grant exemptions to State member banks with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules. The asset threshold will be increased annually based on the change in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions. "Exemptive authority granted to State member banks with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules." The Board may exempt bank holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules, imposing conditions as necessary. Factors considered include whether the provision or rule would impose unnecessary burdens. The Board may exempt bank holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules if they impose unnecessary burdens, with the asset threshold to be increased annually based on the change in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions. Exemptive authority is also granted to savings and loan holding companies and mutual holding companies under the Home Owners' Loan Act. The Board may exempt savings and loan holding companies or mutual holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules, based on specified factors. The Board may impose conditions and consider factors when granting exemptions to savings and loan holding companies or mutual holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets. Factors include burden/cost, safety/soundness, and public interest. The Board has the authority to impose conditions and consider factors when granting exemptions to savings and loan holding companies or mutual holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets. The asset threshold identified in the authority shall be increased annually based on the change in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions.
